metadata.title: CVE-2014-2573 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
The VMWare driver in OpenStack Compute (Nova) 2013.2 through 2013.2.2 doesnot properly put VMs into RESCUE status, which allows remote authenticatedusers to bypass the quota limit and cause a denial of service (resourceconsumption) by requesting the VM be put into rescue and then deleting theimage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2573` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-api - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-api-ec2 - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-api-metadata - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-compute - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-api-os-volume - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-baremetal - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-cells - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-cert - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-common - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-kvm - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-libvirt - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-lxc - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-qemu - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-vmware - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-compute-xen - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-conductor - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-console - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-consoleauth - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-network - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-novncproxy - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-objectstore - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-scheduler - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-spiceproxy - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-volume - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
nova-xvpvncproxy - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
python-nova - 1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1.1-0ubuntu1').
